reviews.sentence: Business hotel in good and bad. Crowne Plaza is in the heart of Adelaide just a couple of blocks from the busy shopping streets. It has everything a good quality hotel needs to have. Rooms are big enough for a weeks stay with a nice desk for working at your room and privacy. The hotel is tidy the staff is friendly but something was missing a character or soul if you like. This hotel is one of maybe too many of its kind slightly overpriced and in need of a facelift soon.

Excellent location great staff. I am a travel agent and was fortunate enough to get an agent rate at this property. The location is great right near one of the many squares and close to lots of shopping and restaurants. A cab ride from the airport should only be about 20 25 AUD which was very reasonable. Immediately upon arrival we were greeted my concierge agent Ric. He was very speedy to pick up our luggage and spent almost 15minutes letting us know all about the city. This type of service is always appreciated as a tourist in a new city. Our room was not ready immediately but the front desk was very apologetic about this and even gave us some complimentary wine while we waited which was not expected but a very nice gesture. The rooms were spacious and clean and beds were extremely comfortable. The room was also very quiet as well which is a big priority for me. They have a nice lap pool steam room sauna and spa. All in great working order well maintained and clean. I used the facilities every day. WiFi was very fast even though we had several devices on it. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone for either business or pleasure. I am a corporate travel agent and even though I was travelling for leisure I would offer it as an option to by corporate clients.

Wow so well looked after such amazing service. From the moment we pulled up at valet parking I did not lift a finger. The amazing staff looked after everything I was greeted at my car door and then they took over I relaxed with a glass of bubbles after my long drive while they sorted everything. I felt like a queen returning to her castle. I did not want for anything they had thought of everything before I could even think of asking. Room service was so delicious and fast with a follow up call to check it was enjoyable. Such brilliant service I shal return very soon. You really do not need to leave the hotel at all.

Attentive Staff and Excellent Breakfast Spread. The staff at the hotel from the check in restaurants concierge and the valet were all very attentive and happy to help. The breakfast spread is excellent and the live cooking station serves a variety of egg dishes.
Even in the dark it was excellent. excellent location breakfast and staff.

Probably one of the best we have stayed at regarding customer service in awhile. Complimentary bottle of wine chocolates on arrival due to acomodation mishap which really was not a real issue in the first place. Awesome view from 12th floor corner balcony room a delicious buffet breakfast to wake up to. Convenient location close to Rundle Mall Rundle St all within walking distance. Overall we highly recommend.

Great place to stay. Loved our stay at Crowne Plaza in Adelaide. Location is brilliant facilities great and the staff outstanding. Nothing was too much trouble and they went out of their way to ensure that both humans and guide dog were taken care of. Our package which included breakfast was excellent value for money. I have no hesitation in recommending Crowne Plaxa to anyone staying in Adelaide. Excellent service and facilities. Ideal location. Minutes walk to Rundle street and mall. Hotel faces onto small parkland area so does not feel like it is in the middle of the city. Sometimes the cleaning was not quite as thorough as it could have been.

Comfy bed but dirty carpets. Very comfortable bedding and pillows. Excellent water pressure in shower. Horrible yellow lighting in the bathroom made getting ready for an event a disaster. Room could have been much cleaner.

We ate at the restaurant Red Salt. The food was delicious and the staff were very attentive. The decor and atmosphere could do with a lift. It seemed a little too casual compared to the very formal staff.

Excellent staff comfortable beds. The staff were warm and helpful. Geo in particular stood out for his helpfulness my daughter said he is the reason they have 5 stars. It was a shame the spa was under repair however the pool gym and sauna were fabulous. At night the air conditioner did not seem to stay cool but it was not too hot.

Average. The room was Okay. Breakfast was stingy. It felt like the place was well understaffed. Waiting 12 Hr to check out is unacceptable. Everyone in line was complaining. Luck I did not have a plane to catch. Being a well traveled person and have been all over the world I can see why people think Adelaide is a Joke.
Great please ensure I always have a similar room. Everything was very good except I do not understand why breakfast is so expensive.
Work Trip. Fantastic only thing which would of been handy was Wifi.

Good stay but had higher expectation due to other stays at Pullmans which had been amazing. Calls to reception was often left to ring out so you had to go down to front office. They did not always follow through with what they promised ie making up an additional bed booking taxis. The buffet breaky had many trays empty and you had to ask several times before they were replenished. Rooms were comfortable and pool area nice. Balconies were small. The hotel was overly busy that weekend so staff may have been under pressure. Found location nice and central. Friendly staff at check in. Comfortable beds. Close to shopping. Replenish buffet breakfast. Answer calls to reception. Nice outlook over park.

Disappointed in Adelaide. When we first arrived we were met with a friendly smile and the staff could not do more to accommodate our early arrival. We were provided with a key to the 3rd floor which happened to be a disabled room. We were fine with the room upon first entering but unfortunately things went downhill from there. The door to the room constantly rattled so much so we thought someone was knocking or worse trying to force their way in and this continued all night. Also the shower was almost useless there was no actual water pressure at the shower head so the water would dribble out which made it interesting when trying to shower. The shower curtain was about 15 cm off the floor and so when you did have a shower it wet the whole room. I can understand the need for people in wheelchairs. etc but I do think it is a safety hazard trying to maneuver around on wet tiles. There was no hope of recycling the towels as they were required to soak up the wet floor after each shower. One tip make sure you chose a pillow from the pillow menu as the ones provided are quite hard and after the fist night I had a sore neck. The location is quite central around the corner to the Rundle Mall the Tram Stop and quite a few restaurants are nearby. Would we go back. probably not.

Excellent location very convenient to Rundle mall attractions very helpful and approachable staff. Service from hotel staff was exceptional. Polite efficient and very helpful. They range in their pillows soft low firm fluffy. be sure to check the pillow if you ’re sensitive to different pillow types. Other than that it was a very pleasant and wonderful stay. Location is fantastic.
Great but please provide checkout times in the rooms. Above.

Not quite there for mine. Booked this place due to the exceptional reviews but honestly it was a bit depressing dark brown beige everywhere plus I scored a ‘ disabled ’ room. Staff were friendly but the basic product was wrong for me. no one ’s fault. My room ‘ card ’ frequently did n’t work when operating the lifts and the restaurant ’s aircon left you sitting in a rather unpleasant down draught whichever way you turned but enough whinging the bed was very comfortable the free wifi was of an acceptable quality and the location was good. But probably next visit I will try somewhere else.
relaxing no pressure it was like being in my own house. I enjoyed it. I was in Adelaide for work but the hotel was quiet clean and bright so it was a great contrast to the busy world of working.

Fabulous except the parking. We arrived on the Friday 15th for a 4 day stay including breakfast. It was our intention originally to not have a car so I did not really research the parking costs. Our plane was delayed so we got into the city a little later than expected and decided to park by meter 820 for two hrs. ouch ok not to worry we will sort out later. As I am an Acor Member the ease of Check In is wonderful. Unfortunately no matter how nice the Reception was they could not get us an economical park. Anyways Room 1421 tho not as Posh as I expected was lovely and once the balcony was unlocked the view beautiful even on a rainy day. We had breakfast on all days very nice. A couple of pizzas wine and a main meal at Pullman. Service lovely. Food excellent and great value with Acor card. Top wine menu tho I would expect no less from South Australia. Was overall a lovely visit. We came to see the Firebirds play Thunderbirds. Our team Won. What can I say. Thankyou. South Australia. Your City. Your Food Excellent as always.

Generally good except for uncomfortable toilet seat. Staff were friendly and helpful room was clean and well presented. However the toilet seat was VERY unusual and uncomfortable this was the main drawback. Also I would have expected a stainless steel rather than plastic kettle in hotel of this calibre.

Short and sweet. Pleasant greetings and easy check in my luggage was carried to my room happily by a host my room temperature was already set nicely so when I arrived I cooled down quickly Adelaide was hot the bed was amazing and I slept extremely well on the mattress and pillows with darkened quiet room great curtains and sound insulation room 809 Pullman Adelaide. The views over Hindmarsh Square park were spectacular. Room service meal was delicious and served within 15 minutes by a friendly hostess. Milk was missing from my minibar so I rang and it was brought to me within 5 minutes perfect service. The toiletries smelt delightful. The breakfast buffet was a veritable smorgasbord of foods some I had not seen before it would have been easy to over indulge. I was waiting for friends from another room so the breakfast concierge happily seated me in a booth for 4 and brought me a perfect coffee whilst I waited for the rest of my party I am visually impaired. I was glad to see no mold in the bathroom or shower. Something I have found in most hotels I have stayed in before. And no mold or bleach smell well done to the cleaning crew. Checkout took 1 minute. All along every team member went above and beyond their call of duty to make sure I was looked after. got me glass of water coffee guided me to the bathrooms lift etc nothing was too much for anything. Thank you for a wonderful stay. Oh one small thing could housekeeping please check the clocks for alarms when cleaning rooms I was startled by a 070 am alarm. It was lucky I had awoken at 0630 so I was already awake because being woken up at 7 am if I had gone to bed late or was planning a long sleep in would have put me in a bad mood or could have damaged my health. it is weird though as I had completely unplugged the clock from power to plug in my phone charger so I do not know how the clock had power in it to alarm at 070. It had no time displayed on its face. Overall I wish to thank all members of the Pullman Hotel Adelaide from the check in check out the breakfast bar hosts the chefs The operators on the phones the cleaners the concierge the luggage carriers everyone worked together so well to make my stay a very pleasant experience. I wish I could have stayed longer.

This is not a 5 star hotel. The bed was comfortable the air conditioning worked well. This is a cheaply refurbished hotel with cheap fittings and the staff are not trained anywhere near the standard of a 5 star hotel. mouldy sauna and pool room the indoor pool is tiny and the gym looks right into the pool with huge glass windows so there is no privacy. There were kids running wild in the pool splashing and jumping in and out and also repeatedly getting in and put of the sauna so it never got hot. They were there from 9 1030pmHotel lobby and restaurant area was filled with screaming babies and kids running around in thongs and board shorts. The room bathroom smelled like sewerage and smell did nt go away during stay and the grout in the shower was covered in mouldtrucks moving large items and beeping with reverse siren after midnight in alley behind hotel. The view from the room was completely covered by a large multi storey carpark. Bizare trance music pumped through loadspeakers at breakfastand no greeting. hello or godmorning at breakfast desk staff appeared stressed and unorganised. Breakfast was mostly greasy hot food and frozen or canned fruit with a few pastries and toast.

Good stay and will stay again when I ’m next in Adelaide. Efficient check in good size room which was comfortable clean and modern. Room service meal was ok but would n’t order it again fish and chips I did n’t really like the type of fish. Overall good stay.

Excellent service. I have been travelling between Melbourne and Adelaide regularly every 2 to 3 weeks for the past 7 months and this was the first time that I stayed in Pullman Adelaide. The service was excellent and I have fault about my stay. And I am looking forward to staying in Pullman Adelaide again.

Fire Alarm. The fire alarm went off 2 nights in a row. Both times it was a false alarm. The first night 14th June was not so bad as it was in the eveningthe 2nd night 15th June was terrible as it was 130am in the morning. And we were standing outside in the cold in 6 degrees. By the time we hit our beds again it was nearly 230am so ofcourse sleep was impossible. I had no problem with the service of the staff. Everyone was courteous and helpful. But if the fire alarm is faulty and this happens regularly then an announcement should be made straight away for people to just stay in their rooms and not come out in the freezing cold. There were parents with young children half asleep. their weekend totally ruined. Please look into the faulty alarm and the management of the process.

Good hotel good stay high quality services. Room is always pretty and comfy loved the firm bed which is important for my back. Services is always good but this time i had to wait quite a while during checkout because of insufficient staffs only 2 to service 6pax checking out and some queries etcArived about 9 930pm with no one to tell me about parking arrangements no concierge readily available was only told of the parking fee valet 2 days later when i check out. and i do nt recall being so expensive in my last 2 3 years of staying on this property.
Service was poor. We stay at Pullman regularly however I believe the service and standards have reduced.

Breakfast very poor. Platinum member Breakfast. Overdone eggs no seasoning in the funnily restaurant “ salt ”. no standard condiments on offer. Plus in the lounge the bar steward was not overly engaging and tended to avoid eye contact therefore it felt awkward to order drinks.

Very disappointing check in experience. Clean tidy room lots of space and huge shower bathroom. After first being told I did n’t have a booking the reception person then proceeded to ask for payment which had already been debited from my account days before visit. I was then asked for a card and was told the physical card needed to be present ops. Forgot to bring it with me. Finally a manager was called and a bond was just deducted from my card via payWave.
